name: Hardest 52: Week Twenty-Nine Trivia Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many people are present at the JSA's Thanksgiving dinner?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Alan Scott, Jay Garrick and Ted Grant are the only three heroes who attend the Justice Society of America's annual Thanksgiving dinner. Alan Scott was the first Green Lantern not affiliated with the Corps, Jay Garrick was the first Flash, and Ted Grant is Wildcat. Later, Obsidian is seen in his shadow form.

questions.text: Who is the newest member of Infinity Incorporated?
questions.explanation:
Jade.

	Jade was the superhero moniker adopted by Alan Scott's late daughter Jenny Lynn Haden, who died in his arms. He is duly horrified by someone else taking her name.

questions.text: Who attacks the new Infinity Incorporated?
questions.explanation:
Obsidian.

	Obsidian is the son of Alan Scott and the brother of the late Jade, Jenny Lynn Haden. He is able to convert to a wraith-like shadow form, where he is super-strong and intangible.

questions.text: Who is carving the turkey on Oolong Island?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Sivana.

	Doctor Sivana is a small and bald mad scientist who is a bitter enemy of Captain Marvel, otherwise known as Billy Batson. In this issue, he carves the turkey with a chainsaw.

True.

	Although he is often seen clenching a pipe in his jaws, it is just for show. Magnus created the Metal Men, a group of metallic crimefighters.

questions.text: What nickname does Chung Tzu hate?
questions.explanation:
"Egg Fu".

	Chung Tzu is another villain who comes to share Thanksgiving dinner with Sivana, T. O. Morrow and other evildoers. He kills one of his own henchmen because he thinks they called him a name.

questions.text: Who is the last to leave the JSA Thanksgiving dinner?
options: They all left at the same time.
questions.explanation:
Wildcat.

	Alan Scott left with Obsidian shortly after the latter attacked Infinity Incorporated. Jay Garrick, being the Flash and having super-speed, leaves unpowered Ted Grant in the dust, so it is his job to turn out the lights.

questions.text: Who discovers that the Luthor-given superpowers are temporary?
questions.explanation:
John Henry Irons.

	John Henry Irons is the superhero known as Steel. His body was literally transformed into steel by Luthor's Everyman Project, which gave normal people super powers, but the steel soon begins peeling off, reverting Irons back to normal.

questions.text: The newest member of Infinity Incorporated has taken the codename Liberty Belle.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The newest member took the name Jade, previously used by Alan Scott's late daughter Jenny. Obsidian sees this as blasphemy, and attacks the new team.

questions.text: Whose medication is taken away from him?
questions.explanation:
Will Magnus.

	Without his medication, Will Magnus is prone to manic-depressive episodes. As long as he takes his medication, he is mild-mannered and polite, just like any other person.
